issue.title: Error: `traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll` and `traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll` are the same file

content.raw:
Yes I guess it only happens when 0 is winning.
When running with 10 instances:

```
#!

(path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.5.ll'), path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll'))
```

I found a case when running 2 instances:

```
#!

(path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.1.ll'), path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll'))
```

It still succeed.

It sounds like the name of the successful likelihood file is just wrong.
content.html:
Yes I guess it only happens when 0 is winning. When running with 10 instances:

(path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.5.ll'), path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll'))

I found a case when running 2 instances:

(path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.1.ll'), path('traindir/likelihood/likelihood.0.ll'))

It still succeed.

It sounds like the name of the successful likelihood file is just wrong.
